definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: With the car, if left behind is not the speed chase.
sentences.chinese: 而跟車，萬一掉隊了也不要超速追趕。

sentences.english: He hurried on, lest he should drop out in the forced match.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，生怕在急行軍中掉隊。

sentences.english: Vacationing % on the island of Oahu, we were waiting in our tour bus for some stragglers to showup.
sentences.chinese: 在瓦湖島上度假時，我們坐在旅遊車裏等候掉隊的人。

sentences.english: Most of the vehicles had already gathered around him, and he was waiting for stragglers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分汽車已經趕上來了，他正在等其它掉隊的汽車。

sentences.english: If you stand still, you'll quickly fall behind.
sentences.chinese: 如果你停滯不前，你很快就會掉隊。

sentences.english: Enemy Squadron Concentrate your attack on the one straggling aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 集中你們的火力向掉隊的那個攻擊。

sentences.english: None will break ranks, tough nations trek from progress.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人會掉隊，儘管整個國家在牛車上緩慢前行。

sentences.english: Some of them fell out from fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 他們中的幾位由於疲勞而掉隊。

sentences.english: Not only had they not kept up, they'd fallen behind.
sentences.chinese: 他們不僅沒有迎頭趕上，反而是掉隊了。

sentences.english: Not only had they not kept up, they’d fallen behind.
sentences.chinese: 他們不僅沒有迎頭趕上，反而是掉隊了。
